severity_rules.description: Lock-in period is present and potentially excessive without clear notice, or is greater than notice period.
Security deposit is significantly higher (>=4 months) than typical norms, indicating high risk.
Security deposit appears higher (2-3 months) than typical norms.
Security deposit is mentioned but amount unclear. This adds a minor risk flag.
Termination rights are one-sided (landlord/lender only) or heavily favor one party.
Late fee appears to exceed normal consumer norms.
